title: Word of Trump Media Deal Is Said to Have Leaked Months in Advance

title: How Joe Manchin Left a Global Tax Deal in Limbo
abstract: Treasury Secretary Janet L. Yellen’s signature achievement is in jeopardy if the United States cannot ratify the tax agreement that she brokered.
byline: By Alan Rappeport and Jim Tankersley

multimedia.caption: Senator Joe Manchin III effectively scuttled the Biden administration’s tax agenda in Congress by saying he could not immediately support a climate, energy and tax package he had previously indicated he could support.

title: The Dollar Is Extremely Strong, Pushing Down the World
abstract: The value of the U.S. dollar is the strongest it has been in a generation, devaluing other currencies and unsettling the global economic outlook.
byline: By Karl Russell, Joe Rennison and Jason Karaian

title: Can a ‘Magic’ Protein Slow the Aging Process?

title: Germany is on edge waiting for the gas to restart on Nord Stream 1.
abstract: A shutdown to perform maintenance on the pipeline, the main artery between Russia and Germany, is expected to end later this week amid heightened tensions.

title: What Pregnancy and Childbirth Do to the Bodies of Young Girls
abstract: An Ohio 10-year-old’s recent abortion has generated fierce debate. Doctors in countries where pregnancy is common in adolescents say the toll of childbirth on young bodies is brutal.

multimedia.caption: An X-ray of a healthy 10-year-old girl. Doctors who work in countries with underage pregnancies say a critical health issue is that the pelvis of a child is too small to allow passage of even a small fetus.

title: They Had Miscarriages, and New Abortion Laws Obstructed Treatment
abstract: Surgical procedures and medication for miscarriages are identical to those for abortion, and some patients report delayed or denied miscarriage care because doctors and pharmacists fear running afoul of abortion bans.

multimedia.caption: Before Texas’s restrictive abortion law took effect, Amanda received a standard surgical procedure for a miscarriage. After the law, when she had another miscarriage, she said the same hospital declined to perform surgery and sent her home with instructions to return only if her bleeding was so excessive that it filled a diaper more than once an hour.
multimedia.copyright: Nancy Newberry for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: Before Texas’s restrictive abortion law took effect, Amanda received a standard surgical procedure for a miscarriage. multimedia.copyright: Nancy Newberry for The New York Times

title: Biden Administration Retreats on Threat to Withhold Arizona Relief Funds
